availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles F. Potter (Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Lewis Potter and Elizabeth Potter. Student in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Postmaster of Franklin in Simpson County from August 23, 1862, to June 19, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 122B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, Franklin, p. 145.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971, NARA Microfilm Publication, M841, Records of the Post Office Department, Record Group Number 28, Powell-Woodford Counties, p. 179 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Charles Frederick Potter (15 Jun 1832-23 May 1908)," Memorial #102791928, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/102791928 (accessed September 1, 2020).
